articles.author: Reuters Staff
articles.title: China's December Manufacturing Activity Expands for Third Month
articles.description: China's manufacturing activity is anticipated to have expanded for the third consecutive month in December, providing optimism for stabilizing the world's second-largest economy amid potential new U.S. trade tariffs.
articles.content: A Reuters poll of 28 economists predicts the official purchasing managers' index (PMI) will remain at 50.3, indicating growth. Chinese leaders hope recent policy support will boost the property market and domestic demand, benefiting manufacturers amid a global economic slowdown.

articles.author: New York Post Staff
articles.title: Major Companies and Universities Ditch DEI Policies in 2024
articles.description: In 2024, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) policies faced substantial criticism and rollback from major U.S. companies and universities.
articles.content: Companies like American Airlines and Walmart began abandoning DEI initiatives, citing concerns about legality and discrimination. At least a dozen prominent businesses, including Ford and Boeing, scaled back their DEI commitments.

articles.author: News.com.au Staff
articles.title: Australia's New Year's Eve Weather: Storms Expected in Queensland
articles.description: Australia will experience varied weather conditions on New Year's Eve, with storms expected in Queensland and clear skies in Sydney.
articles.content: Sydney is expected to have clear skies for fireworks, while Queensland could see storms and showers due to high humidity. Southeastern Queensland faces heavy rain, damaging winds, and flash flooding.

articles.author: AP Staff
articles.title: Former President Jimmy Carter Dies at Age 100
articles.description: Former U.S. President and Nobel Peace Prize recipient Jimmy Carter has passed away at the age of 100.
articles.content: Jimmy Carter, the 39th President of the United States, was known for his humanitarian efforts and commitment to peace. He served as president from 1977 to 1981 and was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2002.

articles.author: Hindustan Times Staff
articles.title: Man Convicted of Wife's Mass Rape in France Will Not Appeal
articles.description: Dominique Pelicot, convicted of drugging and raping his wife, will not appeal his 20-year sentence.
articles.content: The Frenchman was found guilty of drugging and raping his ex-wife and encouraging several men to do the same. He has decided not to appeal his 20-year prison sentence.

articles.description: Full-length news bulletins providing key stories from Europe and around the world.
articles.content: DW News goes deep beneath the surface, providing the key stories from Europe and around the world. Full-length news bulletins are available on the hour, every hour.
